data.title: $ 3 Tuesday Tacos are amazing
data.text:
These are not your regular tacos .. its gourmet and delicious.
Every Tuesday they sampled different flavor of their tacos for only $3 each, usually 3 to 4 types.
If you're lucky  you'll be able try some lengua tacos or poke tacos
Coupon(s) is/are only apply(ies) to regular priced item(s).
The service is good and the owner and staff are very friendly & helpful.
Give it a try.

data.title: Fantastic Tacos.. even better specials!
data.text:
This place is truly a cut above every other restaurant in the area.

The tacos are fantastic (pork and plantain is my fave).

Keep an eye out for their special of the day, as they have branched out to other things (bowls, burritos, chilaquiles, and more).  

The owner and staff are also so friendly!  Highly recommended!

data.title: Great Gourmet Street Tacos
data.text: Chef Jimmy Martinez is a genius. He has elevated the simple yet delicious street taco to entire new levels.  While I've tried the Mango Pork and Braised Short Rib Tacos, my favorite by far is the Pinapple Skirt Steak.  This Asian/Mexican fusion is a delight to the tastebuds.  You have got to try the Pickled Spicy Escabeche as a side.  This is one of the best vegetable dishes I've ever had.  The pickled veggies are tender and delicious with a kick from the Jalapeño. And if you like spice ask for the Habanero Citrus Hot Sauce.  Wow! The tacos are a bit pricier than your standard fare but are delicious and made to order.  The grilled corn tortillas are some of the best I've ever had.  Not the soggy wet corn meal tasting you may be used to. We live right down the street and dine at Pour Vida at least once a week.

data.title: Fantastic gourmet tacos
data.text: This is a very small street restaurant but wow was the food good. My wife and I loved every bite and kept talking about it was "so good" all night. The menu is limited basically to gourmet tacos but their are options for virtually any appetite.

data.title: BEST TACOS EVER!
data.text: OMG! These tacos are like no other, so many unique one of a kind to choose from. WOW! Believe I had the Tempura Oyster, a Salmon and a Blackened Whitefish tacos, they where all delicious, along with a Moscow Mule. Also tried the Kale & Endive Salad, very light and yummy, couldn't pass up on dessert so we went for it and since this is the only dessert there and I could see why, the moist, not too sweet chocolate crust Flan (Cho Flan), It was Amazing, and I really don't care for Flan, but this was very , very, very good. Also their Cadillac Margarita just to end it right, the drinks are frkn good just so you know. I would go again and again, nothing like traditional Mexican tacos, this is an upscale one of a kind taco joint, it ROCKS!

data.title: Very nice with a bit of spice!
data.text: Tasty tacos and wonderful salad. BBQ chicken in the taco and had a Chipotle Corn and Couscous salad. Both with a tang of spice. Delicious! The lunch special came with a vegetable drink or iced tea and at a fair price. I didn't pay and grabbed a table but it was in the $12 range. The seating is inside and here are a few odd-shaped rock tables outside. Umbrellas for the sun would be a nice addition for the tables outside.  Very good service but not for large groups. There were five of us so I jumped at their one table for six.  They have mild, medium and strong sauce; the mild was fine for me. Well worth the visit!

data.title: Expensive but Good
data.text:
There's no denying that this place has really good food - and service!  However, as some have already noted, it comes with a steep price for what you get.  I wanted to try this place out since it was nearby and new.  It helped that it had a lot of positive reviews, so I was already prepared for the hit to my wallet.  I ended up buying a Groupon for one taco from the land, one taco from the sea, and one pressed juice for $12, so to me, this was already a good value.

The cashiers and service staff here are super friendly and very down to earth.  They let me sample all the juices since I wasn't sure what I was getting myself into.  The kale juice was just ok but did taste healthy (if you consider that a good thing), the Chai Horchata with almond milk tasted the best and was very flavorful, the habanero one definitely had a spicy kick to it at the end that literally lingered in my mouth for about 5 minutes, and the beet one was surprisingly tasty, despite having beets in it.  That was one that sounded the most disgusting to me, but because I was able to sample it, and it tasted pretty good after all, I ended up ordering this one.  So I guess you could say Don't Knock it Till You Try It!  

For food, I ordered the lobster taco and pineapple skirt steak taco.  My friend also let me try her nacho fries:
Lobster Taco ($12 for full): Yeah, $12 for a taco, tell me about it!  It was pretty good and stuffed with lobster wherever they could fit it!  They definitely loaded this guy with meat.  It was also topped with a lot of guacamole, so if you had a side of chips there was enough to actually eat them with as much guac as they served you.  However, at $12 I think I would rather buy my own lobster at ABC Supermarket and make my own tacos with it.  
Pineapple Skirt Steak ($7 for full): This was very delicious.  The meat was tender, the taco had a lot of skirt steak, and it tasted light yet flavorful.  It was a bit too salty for my taste, but this is a must try!
Nacho Fries: Ask for these super crispy.  They make it exactly as you order, and they were bomb!!!  The fries with very crispy and went well with the rest of their toppings.  I was actually really impressed with the size of the bowl they gave you and even more impressed by how good the fries were.

The best part about this place is their service staff.  I'm not sure what their names were, but they worked on the night of 4/20/16.  They were the ones that offered the free sample; I didn't even initiate it, and they were just so welcoming and chill in general.  

They have outdoor seating, so this would be a cool place to go to on a summer night.  My friend liked their beer selection and they now serve Don Perfecto.  Overall, this is definitely a place to try out once, especially if they have a Groupon available.  Not sure how often I'll come back as it would break the bank, but it's as good as they say it is!

data.title: A bit expensive for tacos
data.text: This small restaurant has a sexy menu. Tacos made with many different choices of premium fillings. The price is a bit high -- I understand these are gourmet, however a lunch of 2 tacos will set you back about $11 and you'll still be hungry. The food is excellent, however.

data.title: Tacos for Breakfast
data.text:
Really some great flavors here but seriously poor value for money.  My husband and I shared 4 tacos and their (delicious) nacho fries.  At $34 dollars plus a $5 tip it works out at about $8 per taco.  
I would come back and order smarter.  Instead of getting a full taco, order 2 half tacos.  It costs the same and you'll get 2 tortillas with more filling overall.  Plus, it's easier to share.  
Overpriced but delicious.  Nice decor and great staff.  We will come back and hopefully upgrade the star, but to the owners, PLEASE do a better job of your portions. Throw in an extra tortilla on a full order.   You will just leave customers disappointed in the end.   We had to clarify twice that our order wasn't missing half the food.  
Great, great fries though.

data.title: So good came back for seconds!
data.text: Awesome food, amazing staff! They do crazy things to tacos here! Your taste buds will thank you, and will leave u wanting more!

data.title: Best Tacos in town!
data.text: Went here from a recommendation and we were not disappointed. Good service staff and great choice of tacos to choose from. It was yummy indeed! Please stop reading and go get me a taco @ Pour vida! Try it!

data.title: Best Tacos Ever
data.text: Read about this place in a Melbourne, Australia newspaper so had to try it while we were in the U.S.  The tacos were the best I have ever had. Mine was raw tuna with avocado mousse in a squid ink tortilla. Absolutely delicious and full of tuna.

data.title: Tastiest tacos EVER !!!!!!!!
data.text: I tried four different kinds of tacos and they were all a feast for the palate !!!  I highly recommend the mango pork taco.  It was my favorite.  We also ordered the truffle fries.  Once again, it was to die for.  You can also add a protein if you like.  I recommend the skirt steak.  Extremely tasty and you cannot beat the prices.  The customer service was excellent.  These guys went above and beyond to make our experience memorable.  The location is ideal.  A small and quaint eatery with lots of Latin flavor!

data.title: Our favorite new lunch spot
data.text: I work in the neighborhood and we get a lot of out-of-town coworkers visiting us. This is where we take them for lunch. Impressive super-fresh salads and amazing tacos - the tortillas are so great. The chef is friendly and informative and the staff is too! Their juices are consistently good. The Kale Endive Salad is one of the best salads I've ever eaten. They have a small amount of outdoor seating. One of these days we're going to come after work and try out the beer, wine and other festive libations! Give it a try!

data.title: Good local option
data.text:
Chef Jimmy Martinez is the man behind Pour Vida Latin Flavor. On their website it says “They bring handcrafted tacos without fine dining prices”. Really? I didn’t know tacos had fine dining prices!! They have a wide variety of tacos from the land, the sea and the garden. They have a few salads and fresh pressed juices. The space is small, but it has a cute patio. Service was fine and if you live in the area, it is worth a stop but not worth the long drive.
we had:
Lobster Taco Maine Lobster, Roasted Chipotle Corn Relish
At $12 this was the most expensive taco and you didn’t get enough lobster to justify the price.

Short Rib Taco Vanilla Bean Braised Short Rib, Pickled Napa Cabbage, Queso Fresco
This was a flavorful short rib, but at $8 it was light on the meat.

Tabasco Seaweed with Steak Cucumber, Tomato, Avocado, Shaved Brussels Sprouts, Tabasco Seaweed
This salad sounded interesting and to make it more hearty we added steak for an additional $5. The salad was refreshing except they forgot the avocados. I asked one of the servers and he told me he didn’t think the salad came with avocados. I told him to go and check the menu and sure enough he came back with a small cup of avocados. The dressing was on the sweet side and it could have used some acidity to perk it up. The steak was marinated in pineapple juice and was on the sweet side.

You can see the pictures at:
https://travel4foodnart.wordpress.com/2015/07/13/pour-vida-latin-flavor/

data.title: Masih di Promenade
data.text: Pour Vida berada di Promenade Anaheim, areanya bagus and cukup upscale. Saya suka sekali dengan nuansa disini, plus outdoor area yang ok. Makanannya juga tidak diragukan seperti short rib tacos, regular dan shrimp tacos.
